projects.name: Mythos (By BrushBits)
projects.shortDesc: Built a modular RPG combat system in Unreal Engine 5 using GAS, focusing on precise damage calculation, skill targeting, and scalable architecture.
highlights: Attribute System: Health, Mana, Stamina with max constraints; combat stats (Attack Power, Defense, Crit Chance/Damage); real-time monitoring with delegates
Damage Calculation: Multi-factor formulas with Attack Power, Defense, Crit; modular Execution Calculation for damage and healing
Skill Targeting: Mouse-based range checks, vector math for distance validation, AoE calculations from cursor position
Combat Mechanics: Crit system with configurable multipliers; defense-based damage reduction; modular, extensible skill system. Link: https://github.com/xxsKyrreZLX/GasFrame

detail.value: Mythos is a comprehensive RPG combat system built in Unreal Engine 5 using the Gameplay Ability System (GAS). My work in the project focuses on creating a modular, scalable architecture that can handle complex combat scenarios with precise damage calculations and sophisticated skill targeting systems.

The attribute system manages core stats including Health, Mana, and Stamina with maximum constraints, plus combat-specific attributes like Attack Power, Defense, Critical Chance, and Critical Damage. All attributes are monitored in real-time using delegate-driven event systems for responsive UI updates and gameplay feedback.

The damage calculation system uses multi-factor formulas incorporating Attack Power, Defense, and Critical mechanics. Built with modular Execution Calculations, it supports both damage and healing effects. The system includes configurable critical multipliers and defense-based damage reduction for balanced combat mechanics.

Skill targeting utilizes mouse-based range checks and vector mathematics for precise distance validation. The system supports Area of Effect (AoE) calculations from cursor position, enabling complex skill interactions. The clean C++ architecture follows Unreal Engine best practices with efficient attribute capture and debug visualization for real-time feedback.

projects.name: BlackForest (By Venture Games)
projects.shortDesc: Developed a scalable multiplayer survival exploration system in Unreal Engine 5 with robust replication, synced player data systems, and interactive environment integration.
highlights: Network Architecture: Clean replication patterns for consistent multiplayer sync of player health, hunger, and thirst systems
Interactive World Objects: Harvestable and collectible systems with network-safe replication and HUD integration
HUD Systems: Real-time UI updates on personal and team states using delegates and RepNotify for clarity and responsiveness

detail.value: BlackForest is a multiplayer survival exploration system developed in Unreal Engine 5, focusing on seamless network synchronization and immersive player experience. My work centers on implementing clean, scalable replication architecture, ensuring critical player data remains consistent across all clients while maintaining server authority.

BlackForest features a dynamic multiplayer survival experience where players must manage health, hunger, and thirst while exploring a richly interactive environment. Teammates can cooperate to gather resources, share supplies, and overcome environmental challenges together. Collectible food and water sources, as well as other interactive world objects, encourage exploration and teamwork, making every session unique and engaging.

Throughout the project, I followed Unreal Engine best practices for multiplayer game architecture, balancing clarity with performance to build a foundation ready for future combat systems, AI, and complex environment interactions. This approach ensures players experience a stable, engaging survival environment whether playing solo or with friends.

projects.name: Rendering & Shader Development
projects.shortDesc: Real-time visual effects and material systems created through shader programming and graphics techniques. Includes dynamic surface deformation, particle systems, and procedural material transformations.
highlights: Real-time height map rendering and render target systems for dynamic surface deformation
Shader-based particle systems and dynamic material blending for smooth visual transitions
Procedural shader effects using masks, noise, UV manipulation, and Fresnel calculations

detail.value: An interactive snow material that dynamically deforms with footprints by rendering a height map. The system uses a Render Target as a canvas to capture foot patterns via ray tracing and applies them to the snow surface in real time. To handle large scenes, the canvas moves with the character, preserving footprints and fading distant ones. Snow buildup is simulated by blurring footprints, generating a height map to represent depth. Realistic lighting and terrain displacement are achieved using normal maps and Virtual Heightfield Mesh.

Built a rendering engine from scratch using modern OpenGL 3.3 Core Profile. The engine handles buffer management, custom shader compilation with file parsing, texture loading, and MVP matrix transformations. Implemented with a modular class structure and integrated ImGui for debugging. Source code available at https://github.com/xxsKyrreZLX/OpenGL.

Created various 2D and 3D shader experiments on Shadertoy using Fragment Shaders. Projects include real-time 3D scenes rendered with Signed Distance Fields (SDF) and Ray Marching, featuring interactive camera controls and realistic lighting. Also explored fractal iterations and procedural generation techniques to create dynamic patterns with neon glow effects. Available at https://www.shadertoy.com/user/xxskyrre.

This effect simulates a natural transformation between two objects. The dynamic material gradually turns the original object red before fading it out, while a Niagara particle stream flows from the original object to the target, visually linking the transformation. As the particles reach the target, a new object appears, creating a smooth and immersive morphing effect.

I created dynamic materials to simulate transformations like freezing and melting transformations. By adding masks, noise, UV manipulation and special techniques like Fresnel highlights to a base texture to add depth and realism to the material.

projects.name: Sky Arena – Combat Demo for Thali
projects.shortDesc: Sky Arena showcases the combat system of Thali, a third-person RPG. Built using Unreal Engine’s Gameplay Ability System, it delivers a robust and dynamic combat experience.
highlights: Designed skill data structures and event broadcasting using C++.
Implemented core combat logic, including ability activation and logic (GA), attribute management and modifications (GE) and presentation elements such as visual effects and sound effects(GC).
Developed interaction rules such as combo execution, ability interruptions, and skill dependencies through tag tree.
Implemented cooldown systems, energy/mana consumption, and regeneration mechanics.

detail.value: Thali is a fantasy RPG that showcases the bond between the player and their dragon through its combat system. As the tech lead of the studio,I focus on building the combat system using Unreal Engine's Gameplay Ability System. This demo features Shinbi from Paragon as the character model.

The combo system in Thali is built using Unreal Engine’s Gameplay Ability System (GAS), with each attack phase represented by a separate ability. During each phase, a timing window allows the player to chain into the next attack. If the player misses the input or gets interrupted, the system ensures a proper reset, so the next attack starts from the first phase.
Interruption feature: a character will react and be interrupted when attacked during an action. When a skill is interrupted, it properly ends to prevent the character from entering an abnormal state.
Sample skill: Dash. Dash is a fast-movement ability where the actor moves at high speed, passing through targets while applying effects to hit characters.
More skills and features in coming...
